title: 'Our Prime Minister compromised, sold our nation': Rahul Gandhi outside Parliament after LS snub
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of being "compromised" and "selling out" India's progress in a recent trade deal with the US, claiming it was signed under "immense pressure.

title: Delhi man collapses on road, passerby tries to steal phone instead of helping; victim dies
content: In Delhi's Ranhola area, a man collapsed on the road and later died after a passerby attempted to steal his belongings instead of offering help. CCTV footage captured the incident, and police are now searching for the suspects. This tragic event echoes similar past incidents where victims were robbed instead of aided.

title: Ishan out, Sanju in: India spinner announces playing XI vs USA in T20 World Cup
content: Despite a stellar T20I series, Ishan Kishan was surprisingly omitted from Yuzvendra Chahal's preferred XI for India's T20 World Cup opener. Chahal opted for the struggling Sanju Samson to open alongside Abhishek Sharma, a decision that raises eyebrows given Kishan's dominant recent form.

title: Oracle makes a public clarification on the deal that could end up in 30,000 job cuts
content: Oracle is defending its substantial AI partnership with OpenAI amidst reports of potential job cuts to fund infrastructure. Despite a stalled Nvidia deal, Oracle remains confident in OpenAI's funding capabilities. However, the company's massive debt and market cap decline raise investor concerns about its ambitious AI spending plans.

title: The loss that roared like a win: When India pushed Australia to the edge in Adelaide 1978
content: India's 1977/78 tour of Australia saw a remarkable turnaround. After losing the first two Tests, India secured their maiden wins Down Under, including a stunning series-levelling victory. The decider in Adelaide was a nail-biter, with India pushing Australia to the brink before ultimately losing the series 3-2.

title: 'Physically handicapped': Khawaja Asif's brutal admission as Pakistan forces battle BLA
content: Pakistan's defence minister acknowledges the immense challenge of policing Balochistan's vast terrain. Security forces are battling a recent surge in militant violence.  Authorities report killing 177 insurgents in counter-terror operations.  The minister ruled out talks with groups responsible for civilian deaths.  This highlights the ongoing security crisis in the region.

title: MP govt hospitals to get Garbh Sanskar rooms to ‚Äòeducate mind of fetus‚Äô
content: These dedicated spaces are meant to guide expectant parents through prenatal care rooted in traditional Indian practices, from positive thinking and lifestyle discipline to diet and emotional well-being. The idea: shape the mind of the unborn. CM Mohan Yadav announced the initiative Sunday in Indore, placing it under the Ayushman Bharat scheme and linking it to the Union ministry of Ayush.

title: Parents to be blamed for allowing minors to drink & drive: SC
content: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said that there cannot be punishment before trial and directed release of the accused who already spent 18 months in jail. They were allegedly involved in tampering of evidence by swapping blood samples of their kids with their own. Father of the main accused, who is a minor and was allegedly driving the case, is still in jail.

title: How long you will live is mainly decided by your genes: Study
content: The findings are based on an analysis of more than a century of lifespan data from large Scandinavian twin cohorts in Denmark and Sweden. Researchers studied identical and non-identical twins raised together and apart, as well as siblings of US centenarians. Most participants were born between 1870 and 1935, a period marked by high mortality from infectious diseases and accidents.

title: 'Was ICC sleeping?' Ex-Pak star says 'PCB should not back down' amid India boycott row
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal has slammed the ICC for urging the PCB to reconsider boycotting the India match at the T20 World Cup. Akmal questioned the ICC's past inaction on political issues affecting cricket between the two nations, including the Asia Cup and India's refusal to play in Pakistan.

title: TSMC chip supply constraints: Tim Cook says iPhone output hit by limited wafer access
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has downplayed concerns over rising memory chip costs impacting iPhone production. Instead, he highlighted a lack of 'flexibility' in accessing advanced chip manufacturing, particularly from TSMC, which produces Apple's custom silicon. Increased demand for these sophisticated chips is creating supply chain constraints, though Apple is working to boost its access.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection, day 12: Film touches Rs 280 crore
content: Border 2 continues its strong box office run, earning Rs 5.25 crore nett on its second Monday. Despite a natural dip, the film has maintained momentum, with a week 1 collection of Rs 224.25 crore and a total of Rs 281.7 crore. North India remains a dominant territory for the film.

title: Air India flyers land in Delhi, 40 bags left in Mumbai
content: Passengers on a Mumbai-Delhi Air India flight experienced frustration when approximately 40 checked bags failed to arrive at their destination. The airline cited unforeseen technical issues at Mumbai airport for the missing cargo. The flight, AI 2677, landed ahead of schedule, but the early arrival was overshadowed by the luggage mishap.

title: Epstein Files: The conspiracy theory about Stanley Kubrick's death
content: What the thread is really selling is not a claim about 1999. It is a mood about now. A belief that the powerful do unspeakable things behind closed doors, and that anyone who shows us the door gets removed from the building.

title: 'Effort to win trophies will continue': Rohit after being conferred Padma Shri
content: Rohit Sharma, honored with the Padma Shri, expressed deep gratitude for the prestigious civilian award, calling it a momentous occasion for his family. He reaffirmed his unwavering dedication to securing victories for India on the cricket field. This recognition celebrates his significant contributions as both a player and captain, marking a distinguished chapter in his illustrious career.

title: 'Daan' at Haryana YouTuber Arun Pawar's wedding; Rs 71L cash, 21 tola gold
content: A YouTuber's wedding video showcasing substantial cash and gold gifts, termed 'daan' by the family, has ignited a fierce online debate about dowry. Critics question influencers normalizing such practices, especially given the bride's professional achievements. The controversy highlights the persistent issue of dowry, even when disguised as tradition.

title: ‚ÄòNo big deal‚Äô: Manjrekar says India's wins over Pak now feel like beating 'minnows'
content: Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar believes the potential India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match cancellation is insignificant, stating the rivalry has lost its competitive edge. He argues India now dominates, making encounters feel one-sided, unlike past contests. Manjrekar asserts the tournament's value remains unaffected by this fixture's absence.

title: Lower than Pakistan, China: How trade deal with US gives India its edge back
content: With this deal, India bags a place among countries facing one of the lowest tariff rates from the Donald Trump administration. Incidentally, the 18% tariff rate is lower than Pakistan‚Äôs 19%, Indonesia‚Äôs 19%.

title: 5 dead as bus carrying 30 passengers falls into gorge in Dehradun
content: A heartbreaking incident unfolded in the Kalsi region of Dehradun Tuesday morning, where a Himachal Roadways bus veered off the road and plunged into a treacherous gorge along Meenak Road. With over 30 souls aboard, at least five sadly lost their lives.

title: India to buy defence, agriculture goods, aircraft from US: Officials reveal key details of trade deal
content: India and the US have struck a significant trade deal, with New Delhi committing to purchase over $500 billion in American products across sectors like agriculture, defense, and petroleum. This agreement aims to lower tariffs and boost US agricultural exports to India, potentially impacting rural economies. President Trump also linked the pact to energy policy and global peace efforts.

title: Exclusive: Backed by father, Anaya Bangar to undergo gender-affirming surgery
content: Family has stood by cricketer and trans-rights advocate Anaya Bangar as she is all set for a major milestone in her transition.

title: 2 British tourists served ‚Äòleave India‚Äô notice over pro-Palestine stickers
content: Two British tourists were issued a 'leave India' notice by Rajasthan CID for posting stickers advocating for Palestine and opposing Israel in Pushkar. The authorities deemed the act a violation of visa regulations and local sensitivities, leading to their immediate departure mandate. All stickers have since been removed.

title: 'Dhurandhar 2 The Revenge' teaser: Ranveer Singh‚Äôs menacing avatar dominates Lyari town
content: Get ready for an adrenaline-pumping ride as Ranveer Singh reprises his role as the enigmatic spy Hamza Ali Mazar in 'Dhurandhar 2: The Revenge', set to hit cinemas on March 19, 2026. The recently unveiled teaser and ominous poster tease his ascension within the feared Dakait group. Read on to know more.

title: Kiaran MacDonald‚Äôs viral pro debut sparks backlash over bout vs 39-year-old opponent
content: Kiaran MacDonald‚Äôs pro debut turned viral after fans questioned his fight against 39-year-old Marius Vysniauskas. The mismatch, shown on Josh Kelly‚Äôs title undercard, sparked backlash online. MacDonald won on points, while Vysniauskas showed toughness despite extending his long losing streak.

title: Delhi school fee law deferred: Why the new rules won‚Äôt apply in 2025‚Äì26
content: Delhi‚Äôs new school fee regulation law has not been struck down, but it has been rescheduled. After the Supreme Court flagged the haste of enforcing a committee-driven regime mid-academic year, the Delhi government told the court it would not implement the law in 2025‚Äì26. A Gazette notification now resets timelines, caps interim fees, and prepares the ground for full rollout from 2026‚Äì27.

title: Form vs faith: Samson‚Äôs slide opens door as Kishan storms into India‚Äôs T20 WC plans
content: India's T20 juggernaut faces a crucial selection dilemma ahead of the 2026 World Cup, with Sanju Samson's recent form under scrutiny. Despite a strong past record, his struggles against New Zealand have opened the door for Ishan Kishan's impressive resurgence, creating a headache for the management as they aim to defend their title.

title: India-US trade deal: Top stocks that will benefit from reduced tariffs
content: According to MOFSL, this is a high-impact development and will have a multi-layered positive effect on the Indian economy, prevailing market sentiments, and sectors exporting to the US, which will benefit from better competitiveness. Key sectoral beneficiaries include Auto Ancillaries, Defence, Consumer, Textiles, EMS, Consumer Durables, IT Services, Financials (second-order beneficiary), and Utility companies.

title: Uttarakhand man who shielded Muslim trader becomes social media star
content: Deepak Kumar, who intervened to protect a Muslim shopkeeper from Bajrang Dal members, has gained significant online fame. Despite facing FIRs for assault and intimidation, Kumar remains resolute, stating he would defend humanity again. The incident has drawn national attention and sparked a debate on religious tolerance and vigilantism.

title: Mercedes goes berserk in Mumbai: Minor driver‚Äôs 2am crash leaves wrecked cars in Coastal Road tunnel
content: In a troubling incident on the coastal road tunnel, a 75-year-old patriarch, alongside his young granddaughter and her friend, are entangled in legal issues. The minor, behind the wheel of the family‚Äôs high-end vehicle, crashed into another car early Sunday morning, resulting in one reported injury.

title: ‚ÄòWell played‚Äô: US Senator wanting 500% tariff for Russian oil says India ‚Äòearned‚Äô reduction
content: US President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with India in which the US will bring down tariffs on Indian exports to 18%. Trump also made a series of claims related to the trade deal such as India agreeing to stop buying Russian crude

title: Uproar in Rajya Sabha as MP C Sadanandan displays artificial limbs
content: In a powerful moment during his inaugural address in the Rajya Sabha, a BJP politician unveiled his prosthetic limbs, recounting a violent incident from 31 years ago involving CPM activists. His intent was to illustrate the meaning of democracy to the populace, igniting a heated debate with CPM representatives over the theme of political brutality.

title: No boycott call for women as Pakistan set to face India despite men's T20 WC standoff
content: Despite Pakistan's men's team boycotting their T20 World Cup match against India, the women's A team is set to play their Indian counterparts in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. Preparations are on track for the February 15th fixture, highlighting a stark contrast in the handling of the women's game amidst the ongoing controversy.

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan receives Vatican invitation to meet Pope Leo XIV in March
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has received an invitation from the Vatican to meet Pope Leo XIV in March, following a state government request. A 16-member delegation, including special representative K V Thomas, was approved for the March 4 audience. However, a final decision on the visit is pending due to the upcoming assembly election dates.

title: Man moves back to India after 7 successful years in US, compares with life in Bengaluru
content: Many professionals are facing tough decisions whether to return to India after spending years in the US, finding the reality of daily life less ideological and more practical than online narratives suggested. While acknowledging genuine challenges like pollution and bureaucracy, he also noted similar issues abroad and found unexpected conveniences, leading him to not regret his decision.

title: Parents of students chasing degrees abroad get breather
content: The Union Budget has reduced the Tax Collected at Source (TCS) on overseas education and medical remittances from 5% to 2% under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS). This move is expected to provide immediate financial relief to Indian families supporting students abroad, easing their upfront cash burden amidst rising international education costs.

title: Cong fires 4 questions on India-US trade deal; asks what happened to 'Make In India'
content: The Congress party has urged the Central government to disclose the full details of the India-US trade agreement, questioning its impact on farmers, industry, and the "Make in India" initiative. Concerns were raised over India reportedly agreeing to zero tariffs on US goods and potentially halting Russian oil purchases.

title: Trump‚Äôs surprise announcement: How US blinked and said yes to trade deal with India
content: The recently concluded India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) talks put pressure on the Donald Trump administration. In fact both India and the EU have termed the FTA a ‚Äòmother of all trade deals‚Äô.

title: Clippers, Harden exploring trade, sources say
content: The LA Clippers and James Harden are exploring trades ahead of Thursday's deadline, with the Cavaliers one of the teams expressing interest.

title: Sources: Bucks countering trade offers for Giannis
content: The Bucks have submitted counteroffers to teams aggressively seeking a trade for two-time MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo, sources told ESPN.

title: Seattle's Kubiak 'all-in' on LX amid Raiders buzz
content: Asked about reports that he's expected to become the next head coach of the Raiders, Seahawks OC Klint Kubiak said his sole focus is on the Super Bowl.

title: NFL to reevaluate Rooney Rule: 'More work to do'
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday that the league will take a closer a look at the Rooney Rule and all that it encompasses after an offseason hiring cycle that saw only one of 10 head-coaching jobs go to a minority candidate.

title: Maye (shoulder) 'turned a corner,' threw normally
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, who injured his right throwing shoulder in the AFC Championship Game, said he took his normal number of throws at practice Monday and that his recovery has "turned a corner" leading into Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.

title: M's get Cards All-Star Donovan in 3-team deal
content: The Mariners acquired infielder/outfielder Brendan Donovan, a first-time All-Star last season, from the Cardinals.

title: 'Go make a play': Peterson hits 2 late 3s in KU win
content: Darryn Peterson was happy to finally finish a game for No. 11 Kansas, and the Jayhawks certainly needed the standout freshman at the end against No. 13 Texas Tech.

title: Six teams leave RSN Main Street to join MLB
content: Six teams officially left their regional sports network, Main Street Sports, and joined Major League Baseball on Monday, essentially shedding their local-media contracts.

title: Three Alberta junior hockey players killed in crash
content: Three Southern Alberta Mustangs junior hockey players -- JJ Wright, Cameron Casorso and Caden Fine -- were killed Monday morning in a vehicle crash while heading to practice.

content: The USA and Minnesota star's game features highlight-reel assists and goals, penalties and physical play.

content: Our NBA insiders answer the biggest questions for the Lakers, Mavericks and the NBA one year after the shocking Luka Doncic trade.

content: From Bruno Mars to Gloria Estefan, a wide array of Hispanic superstars has graced the Super Bowl halftime stage. Reflect on top performances now.

content: Once upon a time, 600 young adults smiled as one, danced in pastel outfits and sang about positivity.

content: Are we approaching the end of the Pep Guardiola era at Man City? Plus: Man United grab another win and Real Madrid get booed heavily at home, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

content: Carlos Alcaraz and Elena Rybakina are the newly crowned Australian Open champions. Who will win the rest of the majors? We make predictions.

content: Shakur Stevenson dominated Teofimo Lopez Jr. and looked unbeatable. But he's still looking for bigger challenges.

content: Which fights were the standouts from UFC 325? Andreas Hale grades all the matchups from Saturday's fight card in Sydney.

content: After a week of betting, sportsbooks are split on how to handle the heavy volume on Seattle to cover the spread.

content: Interest in Cristiano Ronaldo is already heating up in Europe and MLS, with Manchester United linked. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: "Farmers Protected, Will Buy Oil From Non-Sanctioned Nations": Sources On India-US Deal
content: The India-US trade deal agreed upon between US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi does not compromise the interests of Indian farmers, top government sources told NDTV.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Day 2 Live Updates: Amid Chaos In Lok Sabha, Proceedings Adjourned Till 3:00 PM
content: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Day 2 Live Updates: The Lower House of the Parliament on Tuesday was adjourned till 3:00 pm following continuous sloganeering by the Opposition MPs during the Question Hour.

title: Russian Captain Found Guilty Of Manslaughter Over North Sea Ship Collision
content: The Russian captain of a cargo ship that hit an anchored oil tanker in the North Sea last year was on Monday found guilty by a UK court of killing a crew member.

title: Trump's Board Of Peace Could See US Firm Gain 300% Profits In Gaza: Report
content: A US-based disaster response firm has put forward a proposal to manage aid and supply deliveries into Gaza, according to a document submitted to the White House

title: Class 10 Bengaluru Boy Jumps To Death From 7th Floor After Drinking At Pub
content: CCTV footage shows the boy, a resident of an apartment located on Dr Vishnuvardhan Road in a Bengaluru suburb, returning home along with his friends, who dropped him off at the entrance.

title: Adani Group, Italy's Leonardo Partner To Boost India's Helicopter Production
content: Adani Group and Italian major Leonardo on Tuesday announced a strategic partnership to establish an integrated helicopter manufacturing ecosystem in India.

title: Trump Says India Pledged 'Zero-Tariff Barriers' In US Trade Deal: What It Means
content: US President Donald Trump has announced the US-India trade deal, pledging to slash tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent from 25 per cent, bringing an end to months of uncertainty.

title: Trump Seeks $1 Billion In Damages From Harvard University
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday his administration would seek $1 billion in damages from Harvard University after a New York Times report said the college had won some concessions in ongoing settlement negotiations with the government.

title: Air India Re-inspects Fuel Switches On Boeing 787s After Reported Defect
content: Air India has launched a precautionary re-inspection of fuel control switches on its Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft following a reported defect on one plane.

title: After "Watch His Ass" Remark, Trump To Host Columbian President At White House
content: A month ago Donald Trump told Gustavo Petro to "watch his ass." On Tuesday, the US president will meet his Colombian counterpart for the first time at the White House.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Ambition vs Reality: The Paradox Of India's Defence Spending
content: India's defence budget underscores a familiar paradox: strategic ambition constrained by fiscal and structural realities.

title: From Kevin Warsh To Melania Trump: Epstein's Ties With Politicians, Business Titans
content: The US Justice Department's release of millions of internal documents related to Jeffrey Epstein has revealed the late financier and sex offender's ties to many prominent people in politics, finance, academia and business

title: "Wish Time Had Stopped": Jay Pawar's Emotional Post For Father Ajit Pawar
content: While the Pawar family and Maharashtra are still recovering from the sudden and untimely death of former Deputy Chief Minister and NCP president Ajit Pawar in a plane crash in Baramati, a post by his son, Jay Pawar, is currently going viral.

title: Adani Group Stocks Surge Over India-US Trade Deal
content: Stocks of the Adani Group companies surged on Tuesday in early trade after the announcement of the India-US trade deal, led by Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL), which traded near the upper circuit of 10 per cent.

title: Groom Kills Friend Hours Before Wedding Over Rs 1.5 Lakh Debt, Arrested
content: A groom allegedly killed his friend on the eve of his wedding in Maharashtra's Beed district, fearing he would disrupt the ceremony over an unpaid debt of Rs 1.5 lakh, police said on Tuesday.

title: "Felt Sick To My Stomach": Bryan Johnson On Call With Jeffrey Epstein 8 Years Ago
content: At the time of the call, Bryan Johnson said he had no knowledge of Epstein's criminal history or the allegations that would later emerge.

title: Mumbai To Get New Mayor On February 11, Nominations From 6th
content: Mumbai will elect a new mayor on February 11, with the nomination process set to begin on February 6. Nominations for the mayoral post can be filed from February 6.

title: OpenAI Unsatisfied With Chips, Looks Beyond Nvidia For Alternatives: Sources
content: OpenAI is unsatisfied with some of Nvidia's latest artificial intelligence chips, and it has sought alternatives since last year, eight sources familiar with the matter said, potentially complicating the relationship

title: 3 Indians Arrested In Canada For Shooting Outside Surrey Home
content: Three Indian men have been arrested in Canada in connection with a firing incident outside a residence in Surrey. The three men have been charged with a firearm offence and sent to police custody till February 5.

title: Russia fires over 70 missiles, 450 drones at Ukraine; iconic World War II memorial damaged
content:
Russia launched attack on Ukraine on Tuesday.

Russia renewed strikes on Ukraine‚Äôs energy infrastructure early Tuesday, firing over 70 missiles and 450 drones, according to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. More than 1,000 residential buildings in Kyiv were left without heating as temperatures plunged to nearly minus 20 degrees Celsius. The overnight attack damaged part of an iconic Soviet-era World War II memorial, the Motherland monument, in Kyiv, Ukraine's culture minister said. "It is both symbolic and cynical: the aggressor state strikes at a place of remembrance of the struggle against aggression in the 20th century, repeating its crimes in the 21st century," Tetyana Berezhna wrote on social media.

title: After West Bengal row, non-veg back on Vande Bharat train
content:
Kamakhya-Howrah Vande sleeper goes non-veg with chicken curry

KOLKATA: Railways introduced chicken curry on Kamakhya-Howrah Vande Bharat sleeper, reversing a veg-only menu that sparked a political storm, reports Ajanta Chakraborty. The curry will vary by direction ‚Äî Assamese flavours from Kamakhya, Bengali from Howrah. Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Sunday the change days after passengers and Trinamool Congress accused BJP-headed Centre of ‚Äúpolicing our plates‚Äù. The non-veg option is limited to chicken. Fish will not be served. IRCTC said: ‚ÄúBased on passenger feedback..., it was decided that, for the non-vegetarian option, only a chicken dish (50-60 gms boneless and 70 gms gravy) shall be served‚Ä¶‚Äù

PM Modi Flags Off India‚Äôs First Vande Bharat Sleeper Train Between Howrah-Guwahati In Bengal

End of Article

title: Reigns, Morgan could face new opponents at WrestleMania 42
content: roman Reigns and Liv Morgan are the winners of the men's and women's royal Rumble matches . he can challenge for the championship of his choice, and he'll face an important decision . it's time to look ahead to the biggest superstars in the world on the road to Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas between now and April .

title: What did he say? Why millions ride on the words of Super Bowl announcers
content: the average amount risked on NFL announcer mention markets has grown more than seven times . since September, the average risk on the market has grown from less than half a million per game at the start of the season to $3.55 million on the AFC and NFC championship games .

title: We pitched six Giannis trades to our resident GM -- he chose a blockbuster
content: the Bucks aren't actively looking to trade Giannis Antetokounmpo . the two-time MVP will have a new home by Thursday's deadline . four franchises have emerged as serious suitors .

title: Stick with Carrick or hire another coach? Man United must decide
content: the "caretaker" is starting to back the club into a corner . the club have a window in which to decide who, why and when in terms of identifying and hiring their No. 1 candidate as permanent head coach . carrick is closing that window a little too quickly and it might lead to the club having to make a crucial decision sooner than it wants to make it .

title: Shaun White's next act? Revolutionizing snowboarding (again)
content: SHAUN WHITE, 39, has seen himself in a snowboard bib since he last competed at the 2022 Beijing winter Olympics . he will take a ceremonial run through the Buttermilk Mountain halfpipe to open the March 2025 contest that has brought him to town .

title: Panthers reveal custom 'Vamos Gatos' uniforms designed by Jonathan 'Rekal' Torres
content: "Vamos Gatos! Night" is the Panthers' annual celebration of the Hispanic community in south Florida . the 2025-26 jerseys, dropping on Monday, are the most intricate and intricate ones yet . this year's jerseys were designed by the very talented Rekal! graphic artist .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: LSU moves into top five
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the AP top 25 is out of the top five . ahead of Strong is Maya Moore with 11 and Breanna Stewart with 13 . UCLA becomes the seventh Big Ten tally .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona unanimous No. 1, Illinois in top five
content: Arizona and Miami (OH) remain unbeaten in a new AP poll . just four teams' rankings remain unchanged . the big Ten continues to have two teams in the top five, with Illinois replacing Nebraska as the final team, after dropping two straight games this past week .

content: Moller-Maersk has been investing in the state for over 20 years; discussions were held on new investment opportunities with the CM.

title: GM University hosts Budget 2026 panel discussion in Davanagere
content: Experts who took part in a panel discussion were of the opinion that the Union Budget 2026 is a vital step toward sustainable development

title: Empty liquor bottle buy-back scheme to be implemented through private agency: T.N. Minister Muthusamy
content: The Minister said it was neither the intention nor the desire of the ruling DMK to have TASMAC liquor shops. He claimed the Chief Minister was taking steps to bring about behavioural change among alcoholics in a phased manner.

title: Eight Congress MPs from Lok Sabha suspended for the remainder of Budget session
content: Lok Sabha adjourns for the day after repeated adjournments over Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs remarks on India-China conflict

title: Union Budget a huge disappointment to T.N. people; they will teach a lesson in Assembly polls: CM Stalin
content: When asked for his message to his political opponents, Mr. Stalin¬†said,¬†‚ÄúI don‚Äôt consider anyone as enemies, I only see them as friends.‚Äù

title: Police to introduce locked house beat system in Belagavi
content: Those interested can seek police assistance by sending a message to 8277951146, or meet the officials concerned before locking their houses for long periods

title: Next generation technologies crucial for addressing future agriculture challenges: Himanshu Pathak
content: He emphasised the crucial role of next generation technologies, including AI, genome editing, genomics, phenomics, machine learning, robotics, drones, and big data analytics, in addressing future challenges in Indian agriculture

title: JD(U)'s Anant Singh takes oath as Bihar MLA, brought to Assembly in prison vehicle
content: After taking the oath, he touched the feet of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, his political mentor, before getting back into the prison vehicle

title: S.P. Venkatesh: the composer who gave Malayalam cinema some of its enduring melodies
content: Though he had worked in Tamil, Kannada and Bengali, S.P. Venkatesh reserved his best for Malayalam cinema

title: 15-year-old boy dies after fall from apartment in Bengaluru, police book pub for serving liquor to minor
content: Investigations revealed that the minor had gone to Legacy Brewing Company, located within the RR Nagar police station limits, with his classmates, where he allegedly consumed alcohol and smoked.

title: Supreme Court adjourns to February 10 ED's plea against 'interference' by CM Mamata during I-PAC raids
content: The top court on January 15  said the West Bengal chief minister's alleged "obstruction" in ED's probe is "very serious" and agreed to examine if a State's law-enforcing agencies can interfere with any central agency's probe

title: Vijay‚Äôs TVK seeks applications from ticket aspirants for upcoming Assembly polls in Tamil Nadu
content: However, no announcement has been made so far by the party with respect to the poll-bound Union Territory of Puducherry

title: What led to President‚Äôs rule in the strife-hit Manipur? The story so far
content: With President‚Äôs Rule set to expire soon, discussions are underway to form a new government as tensions remain high in the region.

title: Sabarimala gold row: LDF in Kerala questions Sonia Gandhi link to put Congress on the defensive
content: Kerala Law Minister Rajeeve says Congress is ‚Äòstill at a loss to coherently explain‚Äô the presence of two main suspects in the case at residence of Sonia Gandhi in Delhi

title: Veteran music director S. P. Venkatesh dies at 70
content: The acclaimed composer, known for his evocative scores and popular songs of the 1980s and 1990s, passed away in Chennai, leaving behind a defining Malayalam film legacy.

title: Stern action will be initiated if anyone violates Section-30: Parvatipuram SP Madhav Reddy
content: Madhav Reddy said the rule was imposed against the backdrop of agitations and protests which led to violence at other places in Andhra Pradesh

title: NDA Parliamentary Party meeting: The world is looking at India, says PM Modi
content: At the NDA Parliamentary Party meeting, the prime minister was felicitated for successfully concluding trade deals with 39 countries

title: Chennai triple murder of migrant family: Tamil Nadu government to facilitate shifting of bodies to Bihar
content: On reports that assistance was required to move the bodies of the three deceased to their native State, Chief Minister Stalin instructed authorities to facilitate it free of cost

title: Rename Ladki Bahin scheme after Ajit Pawar: NCP leader
content: The Ladki Bahin scheme was announced by Ajit Pawar when he was the Finance Minister and started in July 2024

title: Climate report: Warming trend persists in Kerala despite slight relief in 2025
content: According to Statement on Climate for the State of Kerala: 2025, temperatures remained higher than normal, though the year was significantly cooler than 2024 ‚Äì the warmest year on record for Kerala since observations began in 1901

title: Air India starts inspection of fuel control switches in its Boeing 787 planes
content: An Air India pilot on February 2 reported a defect with the fuel control switch of a Boeing 787-8 plane after operating the flight from London Heathrow to Bengaluru

title: Delegation demands proper maintenance of R.N. Shetty stadium in Dharwad
content: Among other things, the lone toilet and two urinals in the sports complex¬†are in poor condition, and unfit for use

title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu to visit Kurnool district on February 7
content: The Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh will also inspect the agricultural lands of the farmers on the occasion

title: NIA raids suspect's house in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar
content: The searches by the agency were carried out at a residential house in Hazari Bazar locality in the early hours

title: Budget announcement on Harappan site in Haryana‚Äôs Rakhigarhi met with scepticism
content: A similar announcement was made in the Union Budget 2020-21, but little progress was made at the site.

title: Supreme Court slams WhatsApp, Meta over ‚Äòtake it or leave it‚Äô privacy policy, says will pass interim order on February 9
content: ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt play with the right of privacy of this country in the name of data sharing,‚Äù Supreme Court tells WhatsApp and Meta

title: Rahul Gandhi-Om Birla face off: Rule 349 silent on published or unpublished texts, says expert
content: The Lok Sabha saw a stand off between Speaker Om Birla and Rahul Gandhi when the Speaker disallowed the LoP to quote from the unpublished memoir of the former Army chief Naravane

title: Chief Superintendent of Kalaburagi Central Prison transferred amid inquiry
content: Kalaburagi Central Prison had been in the news following clashes among inmates, allegations of bribery against prison officials, and reports of prisoners being provided expensive liquor and cigarettes

title: Congress asks Govt. to take Parliament into confidence on U.S., EU trade deals
content: In a post on X, the Congress hit out at the government and said India has the right to know details of the trade deal

title: Arms, explosives seized; militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces also ‚Äúsafely disposed of‚Äù 18 IEDs at the spot after recovery, the police said in a statement

title: South Korea‚Äôs tech support to help small farmers in Punjab: CM Bhagwant Mann
content: South Korea‚Äôs vertical farming technology for small agricultural holdings can prove extremely useful for Punjab, says Punjab Chief Minister

title: ED raids multiple locations in Bengal, Delhi in sand, coal smuggling probe
content: The latest raids target key individuals and properties linked to the alleged illicit coal trade, signaling a broader crackdown on corruption in West Bengal‚Äôs mining sector

title: Father hacks daughter to death in Kerala‚Äôs Manjeswaram over property dispute; relative injured in attack dies later
content: According to the police, Umar Farooq first stabbed Sheikh Abba during the argument, leaving him grievously injured. He then allegedly attacked his sister-in-law with a machete.

title: Indian benchmark indices soar 3% as Trump cuts tariff to 18%
content: India and the U.S. have agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods to 18% from the current 25%

title: Work on South Coast Railway Zone to begin soon: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Vijayawada Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Mohit Sonakiya said the work on Errupalem-Nambur and Kotipalli-Narsapur lines were progressing.

title: Delhi government plans new bridge over Yamuna river to ease traffic congestion
content: The proposal was put forth by the Trans-Yamuna Board during a recent meeting with officials of the Public Works Department

title: Children‚Äôs festival held as part of Raichur Zilla Utsav 2026
content: Children Festival was held at the Mahatma Gandhi district stadium in Raichur on February 2 as part of Raichur Zilla Utsav 2026

title: Supreme Court bail to 3 accused in 2024 Pune Porsche crash: Victim's kin say it sends wrong message
content: The case relates to the incident on May 19, 2024, when a Porsche car allegedly driven by a 17-year-old boy under the influence of alcohol fatally knocked down two IT professionals in Pune's Kalyani Nagar area

title: Kochi airport to become India‚Äôs first airport to operate hydrogen-powered buses
content: Procurement and operation of three hydrogen fuel cell electric buses at Kochi airport is part of Kerala Hydrogen Valley initiative under National Green Hydrogen Mission of Government of India

title: India-U.S. deal: Five unanswered questions
content: U.S. President Trump and PM Modi announce U.S. tariff rates have been slashed to 18%, but questions over the broader FTA, Indian investment commitments, Russian oil, Chabahar port remain

title: Why are tribals protesting in Maharashtra? | Explained
content: Why did thousands of tribals hit the streets in the State? What are the reasons behind the protests? What are concerns about the implementation of the Forest Rights Act? Why are land rights, which are at the heart of the protest, a long-pending demand?

title: What is the next phase for rural women entrepreneurship?
content: The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana National Rural Livelihoods Mission has been enhancing rural women‚Äôs entrepreneurship and political power in India by empowering over 10 crore households through self-help groups

title: Union Ministers hail ‚Äòhistoric‚Äô India-U.S. trade deal; Congress says PM has ‚Äòcapitulated finally‚Äô
content: India and the U.S. agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods to 18% from the current 25%

title: Centre has taken note of water contamination incident in Indore, Minister informs Rajya Sabha
content: In a written reply to a question, Union Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Tokhan Sahu said that the area has old pipelines dating back to 1997, adding that ‚Äúsome of it is damaged, so the municipal administration identified the old stretches of pipeline and included them under AMRUT 2.0‚Äù

title: Madhya Pradesh cough syrup deaths: Four-year-old dies months after being in coma in AIIMS Nagpur
content: Betul Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr. Manoj Hurmade confirmed the child‚Äôs death and said the post-mortem examination was conducted in Nagpur, and the body was handed over to the family

title: ISRO tests thrust chamber for LOX-Methane Engine
content: The test was conducted at the Thrust Chamber Test facility at ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC), Mahendragiri on January 27, 2026

title: Survey in and around Kolkata shows most students in 17-24 age group read books only occasionally
content: According to the survey, conducted by the Kolkata-based Sabar Institute and the Sarojini Naidu College for Women, 35% of students in the age group 17-24 years read only occasionally while 25% sat with a book daily

title: Thirupparankundram ‚Äòdeepam‚Äô row: Madurai Collector tenders unconditional apology to Madras High Court
content: Collector K.J. Praveen Kumar, in an affidavit, informed the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court that he had passed the prohibitory orders at Thirupparankundram on December 3, 2025, taking into account the ground situation and to maintain law and order.¬†

title: Rajasthan fully prepared to take advantage of budgetary incentives: CM
content: ‚ÄúThe Union Budget will give new strength to all-round development of Rajasthan and support our resolve to achieve the development goals‚Ä¶ It is a roadmap for a developed India,‚Äù Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma said

title: SAD claims Majithia a victim of political vendetta, after he gets bail in DA case
content: Senior SAD leaders Daljit Singh Cheema and Arshdeep Singh Kler alleged the State government had concocted a false disproportionate assets case against Mr. Majithia

title: BJP names Tarun Chugh as observer for Legislature Party leader election in Manipur
content: MHA calls meeting with Kuki-Zo insurgent groups¬†in indication that elected government could be restored in Manipur soon

title: Parliament security breach case: police oppose bail to 3

title: Coimbatore gang-rape case: Trial commences, counsel for three accused men appointed
content: As per the prosecution, the three men gang-raped the college student in a deserted area near Brindhavan Nagar, close to the Coimbatore airport, on the intervening night of November 2 and 3, 2025.

title: Tamil Biennale will be held in January 2027, Stalin says at Global Tourism Summit
content: State govt. signs 127 MoUs worth ‚Çπ22,794 crore, which are likely to create 65,937 jobs. Tourism infrastructure such as theme parks and camping sites will be set up at 31 locations, says CM

title: 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants deported and another 370 have been identified, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara on Monday told the Legislative Assembly that 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants had been deported from Karnataka so far, while another 370 had been identified under the ongoing drive in this regard

title: Three booked on cheating charge
content: The Kothamangalam police registered a case against three people, including two local BJP leaders, for allegedly cheating a 58-year-old man of nearly ‚Çπ10 lakh

title: Kufos launches new initiative to conserve Kadamakudy
content: As the first phase of the initiative, Kufos will undertake a detailed local-level survey in Kadamakudy panchayat

title: National security on a slippery regional landscape
content: India‚Äôs national security will experience regional turbulence with minimal involvement in the larger international security landscape

title: Rise in southern States‚Äô share in devolution of funds provides no relief to Tamil Nadu
content: The share of Tamil Nadu, which was 4.079% in the 15th FC, rose to 4.097% now, accounting for a rate of increase of only 0.44%; as part of horizontal devolution, the weights assigned to the criteria of area, demographic performance and per-capita GSDP (Gross State Domestic Product) have reduced affecting States like T.N and Kerala

title: A hat tip to Tamil Nadu‚Äôs industrial strength, reforms
content: The Economic Survey of India (2025-26) reinforces Tamil Nadu‚Äôs position as an investment-ready, industry-first State

title: Mob vandalises, torches homes in Chhattisgarh village as police shield minority residents against them

title: NDA Parliamentary party meeting on February 3
